channel.title: Simple low and high target heart rate calculator

item.title: Simple low and high target heart rate calculator
item.dc:creator: @ownagesbot ownagesbot
item.description:
@ownagesbot wrote:

omg what are you doing

[code]public static int THRHighFormula(double THRHighPercent, int maxHeartRateMinusAgeAndRHR, int RHR) {

    return (int)(maxHeartRateMinusAgeAndRHR * THRHighPercent + RHR);

}[/code]

And seriously sort out your naming, its all over the place. You have to cast to an int coz you use a double for the percentage (god knows why if your only doing it in terms of integer’s).

Read full topic
item.source: Simple low and high target heart rate calculator

item.title: Simple low and high target heart rate calculator
item.dc:creator: @newguy45 newguy45
item.description:
@newguy45 wrote:

so

       public static double THRHighFormula(double THRHighPercent, int maxHeartRateMinusAgeAndRHR, int RHR) {

        double THRHigh = maxHeartRateMinusAgeAndRHR * THRHighPercent + RHR;
        return (int) THRHigh;

should become


       public static int THRHighFormula(double THRHighPercent, int maxHeartRateMinusAgeAndRHR, int RHR) {

        double THRHigh = maxHeartRateMinusAgeAndRHR * THRHighPercent + RHR;
        return THRHigh;

item.title: Simple low and high target heart rate calculator
item.dc:creator: @newguy45 newguy45
item.description:
@newguy45 wrote:

woohoo I did somthing right =P[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 21, 2009, 05:21:04 am[/size][hr]so I realized some of the formula was wrong in the first version of this calculator so I made some corrections and added my first ever GUI =D

PS: does anyone know how to make the frame auto “stretch” for when the label returns its value?


/*
 * To change this template, choose Tools | Templates
 * and open the template in the editor.
 */

/*
 * finaltheclacguiframe.java
 *
 * Created on Oct 19, 2009, 6:29:01 PM
 */

package finalthrcalcgui;

/**
 *
 * @author newguy45
 */
public class finalthrcalcguiframe extends javax.swing.JFrame {
    int RHR = 0;

    /** Creates new form finaltheclacguiframe */
    public finalthrcalcguiframe() {
        initComponents();
    }

    /** This method is called from within the constructor to
     * initialize the form.
     * WARNING: Do NOT modify this code. The content of this method is
     * always regenerated by the Form Editor.
     */
    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
    // <editor-fold defaultstate="collapsed" desc="Generated Code">                          
    private void initComponents() {

        pulseTextField = new javax.swing.JTextField();
        ageTextField = new javax.swing.JTextField();
        RHRButton = new javax.swing.JButton();
        THRButton = new javax.swing.JButton();
        pulseLable = new javax.swing.JLabel();
        ageLable = new javax.swing.JLabel();

        setDefaultCloseOperation(javax.swing.WindowConstants.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
        setTitle("Target Heart Rate Calculator");

        ageTextField.addActionListener(new java.awt.event.ActionListener() {
            public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {
                ageTextFieldActionPerformed(evt);
            }
        });

        RHRButton.setText("Calculate RHR");
        RHRButton.addActionListener(new java.awt.event.ActionListener() {
            public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {
                RHRButtonActionPerformed(evt);
            }
        });

        THRButton.setText("Calulate THR");
        THRButton.addActionListener(new java.awt.event.ActionListener() {
            public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {
                THRButtonActionPerformed(evt);
            }
        });

        pulseLable.setText("Take your pulse for 10 seconds");

        ageLable.setText("How old are you?");

        javax.swing.GroupLayout layout = new javax.swing.GroupLayout(getContentPane());
        getContentPane().setLayout(layout);
        layout.setHorizontalGroup(
            layout.createParallelGroup(javax.swing.GroupLayout.Alignment.LEADING)
            .addGroup(layout.createSequentialGroup()
                .addContainerGap()
                .addGroup(layout.createParallelGroup(javax.swing.GroupLayout.Alignment.LEADING, false)
                    .addComponent(RHRButton, javax.swing.GroupLayout.DEFAULT_SIZE, javax.swing.GroupLayout.DEFAULT_SIZE, Short.MAX_VALUE)
                    .addComponent(pulseTextField)
                    .addComponent(THRButton, javax.swing.GroupLayout.DEFAULT_SIZE, javax.swing.GroupLayout.DEFAULT_SIZE, Short.MAX_VALUE)
                    .addComponent(ageTextField))
                .addPreferredGap(javax.swing.LayoutStyle.ComponentPlacement.RELATED)
                .addGroup(layout.createParallelGroup(javax.swing.GroupLayout.Alignment.LEADING)
                    .addComponent(pulseLable)
                    .addComponent(ageLable))
                .addContainerGap(javax.swing.GroupLayout.DEFAULT_SIZE, Short.MAX_VALUE))
        );
        layout.setVerticalGroup(
            layout.createParallelGroup(javax.swing.GroupLayout.Alignment.LEADING)
            .addGroup(layout.createSequentialGroup()
                .addContainerGap(javax.swing.GroupLayout.DEFAULT_SIZE, Short.MAX_VALUE)
                .addGroup(layout.createParallelGroup(javax.swing.GroupLayout.Alignment.BASELINE)
                    .addComponent(pulseTextField, javax.swing.GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE, javax.swing.GroupLayout.DEFAULT_SIZE, javax.swing.GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE)
                    .addComponent(pulseLable, javax.swing.GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE, 17, javax.swing.GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE))
                .addPreferredGap(javax.swing.LayoutStyle.ComponentPlacement.RELATED)
                .addComponent(RHRButton)
                .addGap(18, 18, 18)
                .addGroup(layout.createParallelGroup(javax.swing.GroupLayout.Alignment.BASELINE)
                    .addComponent(ageTextField, javax.swing.GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE, javax.swing.GroupLayout.DEFAULT_SIZE, javax.swing.GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE)
                    .addComponent(ageLable))
                .addPreferredGap(javax.swing.LayoutStyle.ComponentPlacement.UNRELATED)
                .addComponent(THRButton))
        );

        pack();
    }// </editor-fold>                        

    private void RHRButtonActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {                                          
        RHR = (int) (Integer.parseInt(pulseTextField.getText()) * 6);
        pulseLable.setText("RHR: " + RHR);
    }                                         

        public static double THRLowFormula(double THRLowPercent, int maxHeartRateMinusAgeAndRHR, int RHR) {

        double THRLow = maxHeartRateMinusAgeAndRHR * THRLowPercent + RHR;
        return  (int) THRLow;
    }
        public static double THRHighFormula(double THRHighPercent, int maxHeartRateMinusAgeAndRHR, int RHR) {

        double THRHigh = maxHeartRateMinusAgeAndRHR * THRHighPercent + RHR;
        return (int) THRHigh;
    }

    private void ageTextFieldActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {                                             

    }                                            

    private void THRButtonActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {                                          
        int maxHeartRate, age, maxHeartRateMinusAgeAndRHR;
        double THRHigh, THRHighPercent, THRLow, THRLowPercent;

        maxHeartRate = 220;
        age = (int) (Integer.parseInt(ageTextField.getText()));
        maxHeartRateMinusAgeAndRHR = maxHeartRate - age - RHR;
        THRLowPercent = .60;
        THRHighPercent = .70;

        THRLow = THRLowFormula(THRLowPercent, maxHeartRateMinusAgeAndRHR, RHR);
        THRHigh = THRHighFormula(THRHighPercent, maxHeartRateMinusAgeAndRHR, RHR);
        ageLable.setText("Low target heart rate (60%): " + THRLow + " High target heart rate (70%): " + THRHigh);

    }                                         

    /**
    * @param args the command line arguments
    */
    public static void main(String args[]) {
        java.awt.EventQueue.invokeLater(new Runnable() {
            public void run() {
                new finaltheclacguiframe().setVisible(true);
            }
        });
    }

    // Variables declaration - do not modify                     
    private javax.swing.JButton RHRButton;
    private javax.swing.JButton THRButton;
    private javax.swing.JLabel ageLable;
    private javax.swing.JTextField ageTextField;
    private javax.swing.JLabel pulseLable;
    private javax.swing.JTextField pulseTextField;
    // End of variables declaration                   

}

and yea netbeans ftw

item.title: Simple low and high target heart rate calculator
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“BAsh, post:24, topic:309067”][quote author=Punniabi16 link=topic=405518.msg3002465#msg3002465 date=1256111981]
should only use the parentheses brackets ()'s when dealing with very strange math or when you have a condition with alot of logical operators like AND OR and you need to pair a few AND’s to check for 1 OR etc… but it also looks good too i guess.
[/quote]
wtf are you on?

anyway here is an implementation based upon what i understood:

[code]
/**

  • Add two integers!
    */
    public int add(int a, int b) {
    if (a == 1 && b == 1) return 2;
    if ((a == 2 && b == 3) || (a == 3 && b == 2)) return 5;
    throw new InternalError(“Screw this I’m bored. Complete it yourself”);
    }
    [/code][/quote]
    Nah, he meant you shouldn’t use:
return (maxHeartRate - age);

but:

return maxHeartRate - age;

Which I do not agree on, although both code fragments are exactly the same, the first one is way neater.

Read full topic
item.source: Simple low and high target heart rate calculator

item.title: Simple low and high target heart rate calculator
item.dc:creator: @BAsh BAsh
item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

Punniabi16:

should only use the parentheses brackets ()'s when dealing with very strange math or when you have a condition with alot of logical operators like AND OR and you need to pair a few AND’s to check for 1 OR etc… but it also looks good too i guess.

wtf are you on?

anyway here is an implementation based upon what i understood:

/**
* Add two integers!
*/
public int add(int a, int b) {
if (a == 1 && b == 1) return 2;
if ((a == 2 && b == 3) || (a == 3 && b == 2)) return 5;
throw new InternalError("Screw this I'm bored. Complete it yourself");
}

item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

abraham2119:

how are you explaining what it is used for if you are using it in the wrong context, meaning that you are providing him with an erroneous ‘explanation’ (you really just posted a piece of code so i dont see how this is considered an explanation)

It’s not really erroneous, it was just used wrongly, I could easily just correct myself by removing that tiny little mistake I said.

If you actually take into account what was the main point and not just the code, then you would realize that, yes the code is wrong, but the explanation is right.

Watch, I’ll fix my post right now.

item.source: Simple low and high target heart rate calculator

item.title: Simple low and high target heart rate calculator
item.dc:creator: @newguy45 newguy45
item.description:
@newguy45 wrote:

[quote=“x blitz x, post:17, topic:309067”][quote author=ownagesbot link=topic=405518.msg2999074#msg2999074 date=1255822575]

you can make some things shorter 

public static int targetheartrate(int age, int maxHeartRate) {

		int maxRateMinusAge = maxHeartRate - age;
		return maxRateMinusAge;
		
	}

can be just:

public static int targetheartrate(int age, int maxHeartRate) {

		return (int)(maxHeartRate - age);
		
	}

etc =)
but it’s pretty good for a first app I guess ^^

why is int in a bracket, also where did my maxRateMinusAge var go?

public static int targetheartrate(int age, int maxHeartRate) {
    //int maxRateMinusAge = maxHeartRate - age; - See Comment B
    return (int)/*See Comment A*/(maxHeartRate - age);
}

Comment A:

The int is there to basically say, whatever is next it’s a integer, it’s a conversion.
If the line after it, (maxHeartRate - age), was to come back as a double, you would get runtime errors as you’ve defined this method to return a integer type, not a double.

Comment B:

The reason that line is not needed is because you can just do all the calculations in the return statement.
[/quote]Im sorry but when did (int - int) have any probability of returning double…?

It doesn’t. I was just trying to explain what it means, and what it is used for.

you assume wrong - it just chops off the extra data

there will be rounding functions somewhere in java, i dont know the stdlib

http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/api/java/lang/Math.html#round(double)[/quote]

oh, thankyou =P

Read full topic

public static int targetheartrate(int age, int maxHeartRate) {
    //int maxRateMinusAge = maxHeartRate - age; - See Comment B
    return (int)/*See Comment A*/(maxHeartRate - age);
}

Comment A:

The int is there to basically say, whatever is next it’s a integer, it’s a conversion.
If the line after it, (maxHeartRate - age), was to come back as a double, you would get runtime errors as you’ve defined this method to return a integer type, not a double.

The reason that line is not needed is because you can just do all the calculations in the return statement.
